page.title: 14BISHOP(CARLISLE): DAILY WORK
page.content: The Bishop's day begins at about 7am when he gets up. He then goes to the chapel in the castle to say his prayers. At 9am he is available to see people and arrange interviews. He then opens his mail and answers all the letters that need answering. His morning, then, is usually routine. The afternoon is often taken up with community meetings or interviews that last until 5.30pm. At 7.30pm most evenings there is a confirmation service somewhere in the district. He normally finishes work by 9pm. Travel is an important feature of his life. He travels widely throughout Cumbria and goes to London once a week to attend the House of Lords. Future vicars often stay at Rose Castle just before they are ordained by the Bishop.
